definition: Edison (name)/Thomas Alva Edison (1847-1931), American inventor and businessman
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: At the age of ten Edison had already built a small chemistry lab of his own.
sentences.chinese: 愛迪生十歲時就已自建成一個小型化學實驗室。

sentences.english: Actually I did grow up in Edison, New Jersey.
sentences.chinese: 我是在新澤西州的愛迪生市長大的。

sentences.english: Edison won his spurs as an inventor while young.
sentences.chinese: 愛迪生很年輕時就因創造發明而一舉成名。

sentences.english: Gilbert discovered electricity but edison invented the light bulb.
sentences.chinese: 吉伯特發現了電，而愛迪生髮明瞭燈泡。

sentences.english: There are many people who say Thomas Edison single-handedly invented the twentieth century.
sentences.chinese: 有許多人認爲是愛迪生一手創造了二十世紀。

sentences.english: Edison asked his father why he was not able to hatch chickens while hens can.
sentences.chinese: 愛迪生問他爸爸爲什麼他不能孵出小雞，而母雞卻能。

sentences.english: Edison gates this madman than anyone can?
sentences.chinese: 愛迪生蓋茨這種瘋子誰人能比？

sentences.english: Edison, the inventor of light, was said to be stupid when he was young.
sentences.chinese: 電燈的發明者愛迪生在幼年時曾被認爲很愚鈍。

sentences.english: Failure is the mother of success. Take the example of Edison inventing the light bulb.
sentences.chinese: 失敗是成功之母，以愛迪生髮明電燈爲例。

sentences.english: Edison is a great inventor whose fame is world-wide.
sentences.chinese: 愛迪生是一位偉大的發明家，他名揚天下。

sentences.english: E. g. This is one of Edison's inventions.
sentences.chinese: 這是愛迪生的發明之一。

sentences.english: The poem I wrote for the Edison Roetry Festival was about my dad.
sentences.chinese: 這次，我爲愛迪生詩歌節寫的詩是關於我爸爸的。

sentences.english: Edison hadfullyshownhis positiveness and humour through this fire accident.
sentences.chinese: 愛迪生的樂觀風趣在這場大火面前表現得更加突出。

sentences.english: Let me take Edison for example.

definition: Franklin/Benjamin Franklin (1706-1790), US Founding Father, scientist and author/surname Franklin

pinyin: Di4 yi1 ci4 Shi4 jie4 Da4 zhan4

definition: lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
Winston Churchill (1874-1965), UK politican and prime minister 1940-1945 and 1951-1955/surname Churchill
Jobs (name)/see also 史蒂夫·喬布斯|史蒂夫·乔布斯[Shi3 di4 fu1 · Qiao2 bu4 si1], Steve Jobs
